resources.string: Enter Station pressure and Temperature. The field Elevation is optional. The application will calculate pressure altitude and 3 results of density altitude (for comparison). All implemented equations are described on Wikipedia pages: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pressure_altitude and https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Density_altitude. Choose corresponding units G.State.options. You can also select ft or m for output units.
The first density altitude equation is calculated from the atmospheric pressure and the outside air temperature (assuming dry air).
The second equation is implementation of The National Weather Service formula. NWS is an agency of the United States federal government that is tasked with providing weather related information.
The final equation is the approximate formula for calculating density altitude based on pressure altitude.
